description.narrative: Strengthening Institutional and Human Resources Capacities of the Ministry of Social Solidarity Support to Covid-19 Response

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: - Number of villages that benefit from Takaful and Karma beneficiaries programme who receive awareness messages on Covid-19 - Number of beneficiaries reached - Number of pensioners and rural community leaders receiving their monthly stipend through e-wallet - Number of emergency operations rooms established and connected to Red Crescent - Number of volunteers mobilized - System established and promoted to connect central ministry with directorates - Number of small businesses created by NGOs through the fund - Number of direct and indirect beneficiaries from the projects - Number of employees who are registered under the social security schemes (health, social insurance, etc.) - Guidelines to respond to COVID-19 in elderly care institutions are developed and operational - Digitized system linking all elderly care institutions to central department at MOSS is up and running - Grievance center is operational - Number of PPEs and other consumables provided - Number of PWDs who access call center

comment.narrative: Project budget was signed as of January 2021
Project budget was signed as of January 2021

- 700 social workers and MoSS employees are trained on Waai Program Issues (Positive Parenting - Hygiene and Covid 19 Protection issues - Maternal Child Health - Early detection of disabilities - psychological support to children affected by covid 19 trauma) through trainings and workshops - 40 awareness episodes around 8-10 minutes each are aired on renowned high listenership radio networks - E-networks with MoSS directorates and key departments including Red Crescent are digitized to enhance services provided by MoSS programs - PPEs for workers for each elderly home per day (200 pair of gloves + 100 respirators) for 6 months are procured - 200 MoSS employees at helpline for PWDs are trained to respond to COVID-19 inquiries and means for protection

• The concept note and detailed plan of providing training for social workers had been completed to train them on Waai Program Issues (Positive Parenting - Hygiene and Covid 19 Protection issues - Maternal Child Health - Early detection of disabilities - psychological support to children affected by covid 19). • Manual for Training of Trainers (TOT) and stepdown training of Social Workers (Ra’edat) was developed including the pre- and post- assessment of trainers (co-funded by the Government of the United Kingdom and the European Union). • The plan of social media campaigns on highly viewed news networks and facebook is currently being prepared for enhancing social dialogue on Covid 19 detriments on socio-economic issues. • Documentation of feature stories of child marriage (Short film) for the implementation of child marriage campaign under Waai Campaign took place and the final documentary is under production (co-funded by the Government of the United Kingdom and the European Union). • Waai Comprehensive Manual covering 12 key Waai messages has developed, designed and printed to be used by social workers (Raedat), MoSS personnel, communication experts, NGO personnel etc. (co-funded by the Government of the United Kingdom and the European Union). • Child marriage booklet had been developed, designed and disseminated in Waai campaigns in 4 governorates in Upper Egypt as part of a national campaign under the auspices of the Minister of Social Solidarity. • Production of info graphs and dramatic photography on gender-based violence, highlighting success stories of empowered women who managed to overcome their discriminatory circumstances in their local communities was finalized as part of a social media campaign during the 16 days of activism against gender-based violence. • By the 8th day, the social media campaign- co-funded by the Government of the United Kingdom and the European Union- reached around 8 million persons and the official page of the Ministry of Solidarity received more than 380,000 interactions, 8,500 comments, and more than 500,000 views of the campaigns videos. Additionally, on-the ground awareness activities by Ra’edat reached more than 100,000 beneficiaries. • A concept note has been prepared for the communication campaign to extend social protection to informal workers and promote digital financial inclusion. • A national consultant was recruited to support the design and implementation of all IT related activities aiming at establishing a network of social emergency operating rooms (EOR) in all governorates hosted by the Red Crescent Association in collaboration with MoSS to immediately intervene and support marginalized groups amid Covid-19 crisis. • Criteria of beneficiaries selection and targeted governorates were finalized based on MoSS databases of beneficiaries. • An actuarial study had been conducted for a new casual workers fund proposed by Ministry of Social Solidarity (MoSS) including financial and demographic projections. • The plan of provision of personal protective equipment had been finalized according to the most updated data from MoSS database on 162 Elderly Care Institutions in 22 governorates hosting around 3,377 elderly and employing 1,100 workers. Additionally, there are 19 Homeless Shelters in 11 governorates hosting 735 persons and employing 400 workers. • Request for quotation for PPEs for elderly care institutions and homeless shelters was prepared and the process is being completed for advertisement. • A national Coordinator of the Rehabilitation Services is recruited to provide the needed supervision, implementation, organization, and follow up activities of rehabilitation services provided by MoSS to PWDs in line with the Rehabilitation Governance Strategy. • A national consultant is recruited to oversee the policy, planning, and coordination of programs for PwDs under the MOSS and Law #10 of 2018 on the rights of persons with disabilities as well as providing technical support to the Rehabilitation and Social Care of Persons with Disabilities at the Ministry of Social Solidarity (supported by the Government of the United Kingdom and the European Union). • National consultants are being recruited for the call center and grievance center supporting elderly care institutions’ and homeless shelters’ employees: TORs were prepared and being advertised.

- Produce mass media and social media campaign to promote protection against COVID-19 especially among groups at risk - Support digital financial inclusion to facilitate economic relief through MoSS for pensioners and women rural leaders through the mobile wallet infrastructure - Establish a network of social emergency operating rooms in all governorates hosted by the Red Crescent Association in collaboration with MoSS to mobilize volunteers on the ground to immediately intervene and support marginalized groups amid Covid-19 crisis - Set a €2 million fund to support NGOs proposals for creating local projects to meet the demands of local markets and job creation - Establish a unified registration and monitoring system for all micro-businesses funded by microcredit- supported by MoSS and support their transition to the formal banking sector - Establish a grievance center to receive anonymous complaints from elderly people at elderly care institutions - Provide accessible informative materials on Covid-19 adapted to PWD, precautions and guidance through the call center - Establish guidelines for early detection of cases, protection schemes for employees, hygienic procedures in elderly homes and rehabilitation centers for PwDs
